Tucson kicks up the blue light of his optics to give everyone a bit more li=
ght.  He was determined to reach the outside and meet up with Leo Prime to =
get to the bottom of the stasis pod trade off which he had NEVER been told =
or agreed to.   He was overstepped by Leo and was not happy.  In all his li=
fe he never thought he could feel distrust for a fellow Prime but, now he f=
elt it.  He felt betrayed by the very being he thought was honest with him.=
  And now he felt that the one who truly earned that right was Big Convoy. =
 But now things had to change.  He had to gain full command of his division=
 and it meant having to tell Leo in a civil manner that it was best for him=
 to stand down and return full leadership to Tucson Prime, who would never =
in his life, submit to such an unspeakable demand of trading a life in exch=
ange for cooperation.

So he sends a message to Leo hoping it would reach h=
im.

Leo, it has come to my attention that you have made an unspeakable dem=
and with the Predicons in order to establish their cooperation.  By doing s=
o you overstepped my command and agreed to something I would never agree to=
.   Needless to say when all is said and done, I expect you to answer for y=
our actions and I demand that your unspeakable bargain be renounced immedia=
tely, as well as your chain of command.  I will allow you to remain among u=
s but keep in mind you will be under my command.  The same will hold true f=
or Rodimus upon his return.  And now, to take your place, I hereby request =
that Big Convoy assists me in leadership of our troop."

He turns to Big Co=
nvoy.

" I would be honored if you would take your place beside me as leade=
r of my Maximal clan.  My command is your command and you have proven to be=
 more than trustworthy.  Everyone, you are all welcome among my clan.  Our =
home is your home now."

He then focuses on the door.

" That might need mo=
re than just one of us to get open."




Don't be envious of what you don't=
 have, be grateful for things you already posses.  Nothing is worth more th=
an family and friends.

On Dec 21, 2011, at 12:22 PM, Super Cyclonus <super=
cyclonus@...> wrote:

 continued with her pulses then, attempting to

ckages became heavier, and as her active sensors

 more useless, she began to switch over to passive
> > ones. Running her op=
tics to an ultraviolet mode if it was availabile, and
> > seeing fi she cou=
ld begin to run energy blockage traces, to hopefully track
> > where teh ja=
mming was heavier.
> >

eadying to travel
> > underground, she went over to try and scan the area t=
o see where further
> > signatures might be coming from. Still not breaking=
 her cloak, intent on
> > staying aboveground.
>

> 
> Simply put, =
the closer they got to the cave, the heavier the jamming
> got. It was as i=
f it was a foci of some sort, perhaps one of the
> places, if not THE place=
 from which the disruptive energies were
> coming from.
>

> DINOBOT sat to the back as the MAXIMALS went to go down teh tunnel.  IF
>=
 > there was an ambush ahead, then they would take the brunt of it, and any=

> > hidden defenses would target and attrite them first. While also giving=
 the
> > PREDACONS effective control of the tunnel up to the surface in cas=
e a quick
> > escape was needed or other uses could be maintained for it.
>=

> > facility, if it is such, is probably underground quite simply as that =
is
> > where the most stable ground is. Aboveground things are too muddy fo=
r a
> > solid base iwthout using heavy technology to establish it. Which wo=
ld be
> > more noticable to outside analysis. So they have a stable base in=
 the
> > caverns. It also may have to do something with their jamming techn=
ology as
> > well."
> >
> > Not saying the obvious 'it was a trap'.
> 
> <N=
EW>
> 
> TORCA grunted as if he suspected that something more was at play h=
ere
> as well, however he continued to followed LEO PRIME into the cave
> o=
pening.
> 
> The cave itself was quite large, at least once you passed thro=
ugh the
> mouth of it. It quickly began to descend its curving path leading=

> further and further into the darkness that was below. The walls were
> l=
ike any other cave, rough and natural, thee was no ambient light in
> here,=
 except for whatever light spilled in from the mouth of the cave
> or what =
the PREDACONS and MAXIMALS cared to utilize.
> 
> Sensors were getting more=
 and more muffled as they passed into it.
> Passive ones still abosorbed, b=
ut active ones were basically of little
> to no use beyond a few feet espea=
cially ones that used radio or energy
> waves that went outside the normal =
visual or auditory ranges.
> 
> Ahead of them they could hear something roa=
r in the distance,
> something loud and reptillian - it was TUSCON! From th=
e sound of it,
> he was perhaps several hundred meters ahead of them deeper=
 into the
> cave.
> 
> However behind them, as the last of the PREDACONS we=
re making their
> way in, a metallic 'door' slid across the mouth of the ca=
ve blocking
> out any external light as well as any chance of egress.
> 
> =
The trap, at least this section of it, had been sprung!
> 
> OOC: Adam the =
'door' will wait for all the preds and maxi's, but it is
> up to you if Bla=
ckarachnia was inside or outside when the door closed.
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> - Pr=
eston

r thought he could feel distrust for a fellow Prime but, now he felt it. &n=
bsp;He felt betrayed by the very being he thought was honest with him. &nbs=
p;And now he felt that the one who truly earned that right was Big Convoy. =
 But now things had to change.  He had to gain full command of hi=
s division and it meant having to tell Leo in a civil manner that it was be=
st for him to stand down and return full leadership to Tucson Prime, who wo=
uld never in his life, submit to such an unspeakable demand of trading a li=
fe in exchange for cooperation.</div><div><br></div><div>So he sends a mess=
age to Leo hoping it would reach him.</div><div><br></div><div>Leo, it has =
come to my attention that you have made an unspeakable demand with the Pred=
icons in order to establish their cooperation.  By doing so you overst=
epped my command and agreed to something I would never agree to.   Nee=
dless to say when all is said and done, I expect you to answer for your act=
ions and I demand that your unspeakable bargain be renounced immediately, a=
s well as your chain of command.  I will allow you to remain among us =
but keep in mind you will be under my command.  The same will hold tru=
e for Rodimus upon his return.  And now, to take your place, I hereby =
request that Big Convoy assists me in leadership of our troop."</div><div><=

n.  My command is your command and you have proven to be more than tru=

olet mode if it was availabile, and<br>

un energy blockage traces, to hopefully track<br>

s heavier.<br>

 readying to travel<br>

<br>
Simply put, the closer they got to the cave, the heavie=
r the jamming<br>
got. It was as if it was a foci of some sort, perhaps one=
 of the<br>
places, if not THE place from which the disruptive energies wer=
e<br>
coming from.<br>

 hidden defenses would target and attrite them first.  While also giving th=

> Speaking over to TORCA, "I would assume a question =
of geology.  Their<br>
> facility, if it is such, is probably undergroun=
d quite simply as that is<br>

round things are too muddy for a<br>

chnology to establish it.  Which wold be<br>

y have to do something with their jamming technology as<br>

<NEW>=
<br>
<br>
TORCA grunted as if he suspected that something more was at play =
here<br>
as well, however he continued to followed LEO PRIME into the cave<=
br>
opening.<br>
<br>
The cave itself was quite large, at least once you pa=
ssed through the<br>
mouth of it. It quickly began to descend its curving p=
ath leading<br>
further and further into the darkness that was below. The w=
alls were<br>
like any other cave, rough and natural, thee was no ambient l=
ight in<br>
here, except for whatever light spilled in from the mouth of th=
e cave<br>
or what the PREDACONS and MAXIMALS cared to utilize.<br>
<br>
Se=
nsors were getting more and more muffled as they passed into it.<br>
Passiv=
e ones still abosorbed, but active ones were basically of little<br>
to no =
use beyond a few feet espeacially ones that used radio or energy<br>
waves =
that went outside the normal visual or auditory ranges.<br>
<br>
Ahead of t=
hem they could hear something roar in the distance,<br>
something loud and =
reptillian - it was TUSCON! From the sound of it,<br>
he was perhaps severa=
l hundred meters ahead of them deeper into the<br>
cave.<br>
<br>
However b=
ehind them, as the last of the PREDACONS were making their<br>
way in, a me=
tallic 'door' slid across the mouth of the cave blocking<br>
out any extern=
al light as well as any chance of egress.<br>
<br>
The trap, at least this =
section of it, had been sprung!<br>
<br>
OOC: Adam the 'door' will wait for=
 all the preds and maxi's, but it is<br>
up to you if Blackarachnia was ins=
ide or outside when the door closed.<br>
